column2: The Roman Legionaries were known to be one of the most disciplined force in history. Working in cohorts, units were severly punished if they were found to be working individually.
The fearless warriors of the Kamayuk order are trained here. They represent the elite of the Inca war machine and entire armies have been known to rout at the sight them.

Heavily influenced by the Lollard movement within the Catholic Church, the Hussite heretics were a proto-Protestant movement who advocated nationalism and increasing awareness to social issues. Defining features in-game:\n§Y*§! Autocephalous Patriarchs under Kings\n§Y*§! Patriarchs can grant divorces

Tondrakians are a heretical Christian sect which may have been a derivative of Paulicianism originating in the city of Tondrak, Armenia. They deny the sacramentality of marriage and thus encourages sexual promiscuity. They have no formal rites and no strict church hierarchy. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is no religious head
§Y*§! Tondrakians may install women as priests
§Y*§! Tondrakians may have concubines

The reformed South African religion is a fusion of many popular beliefs, but most prominently of the beliefs of the Zulu and the Sens people with a single Holy Book including a creation myth, chapters on the spirits, totem animal fables and gods, most prominent being Unkulunkulu and Cagn. The church also has a standardized liturgy and a formal church hierarchy led by a High Priest (or Priestess), who can be vassalized by secular rulers. Defining features in-game:\n§Y*§! There is always a High Priest, even if unlanded\n§Y*§! The High Priest can call Great Holy Wars

South African religion is a blanket term for the diverse pagan beliefs of the tribes of Sub-Saharan South Africa. Ancestor worship, animism and totemistic shamanism dominate, but there also various pantheons of gods. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all other pagans
§Y*§! Rulers are limited to Gavelkind Succession
§Y*§! Rulers cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Inferior at conversion and vulnerable to non-pagan missionaries
§Y*§! Defensive bonuses in South African Pagan counties
§Y*§! The West African Pagan faith can be Reformed

The reformed Inca religion has a proper Holy Book, a standardized liturgy and a formed church hierarchy led by a dedicated High Priest who can be vassalized by secular rulers. Defining features in-game:\n§Y*§! There is always a High Priest, even if unlanded\n§Y*§! The High Priest can call Great Holy Wars

The Inca religion features a creation myth centered the legendary founder of the Inca Dynasty, Manco Cápac. Revered as a god of fire and sun, the mythology features his coming to power as its legend. The Incas permitted different cultures to keep their individual religions, which resulted in overlapping of the various gods. Some of the gods are Inti, god of sun, Viracocha, god of everything, Yakumama, mother of water and Apu Illapu, god of thunder and lightning. Defining features in game:
§Y*§! Low-tech non-pagans have very low Supply Limit in Pagan counties
§Y*§! Rulers are limited to Gavelkind Succession
§Y*§! Inferior at conversion and vulnerable to non-pagan missionaries
§Y*§! Rulers lose Prestige if at peace for too long
§Y*§! The Inca faith can be reformed

Kabbalah Judaism is a Jewish movement with Gnostic influences. Adopting relgious thoughts from other religions, Kabbalah is a set of esoteric teachings meant to explain the relationship between an unchanging, eternal, and mysterious Ein Sof, and the mortal and finite universe. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is no religious head
§Y*§! Kabbalah Jews may install women as priests
§Y*§! Can restore Israel if the Promised Land is reclaimed
